communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: SSCT and Transportation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Official LAUSD documents which displayed the School Site Crisis Team and their protocols at Venice Senior High School for years 2006-2007 and 2014-2015. This should include the full group's names, titles, contact information. This should also include according to like documents days this team coordinated or met to train on School Site Crisis Team ("SSCT") protocols.

I also request the full official LAUSD contact directory for all Los Angeles School Police Department staff for school years 2006-2007 and 2014-2015.

I also request for all sports teams, classes, clubs at Venice Senior High School years 2006-2007 and 2014-2015 travel arrangement/planning as provided to parents and staff. This should include bus routing documents, transportation vendor plans, both nationally/internationally, prospective or actual.

In addition I request for years 2006-2007 and 2014-2015 all school bus routes with origins/ stops for transport of any individual being transported to or from Venice Senior High School or Venice Skills Center located nearby.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Remy Noìchlaf

communications.subject: Auto Reply
communications.communication:
Hello,

This email is in response to your California Public Records Act (PRA) request.  Your request will be reviewed and the appropriate departments contacted to determine if disclosable records relevant to your request exist.

As required under California Code section 7922.535(a), the Los Angeles Unified School District (District) will make a determination within 10 days as to whether or not a request is seeking records that are publicly disclosable and, if so, to provide the estimated date that the records will be made available.  There is no requirement for a public agency to actually produce the records within 10 days of receiving a request, unless the requested records are readily available.  Still, the District prides itself on always providing all publicly disclosable records in as timely a manner as possible.

Should you have any questions, please contact the Office of the General Counsel at (213) 241-7600.

Thank you.

PLEASE DO NOT RESPOND TO THIS EMAIL.

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All letters, emails, and documents related to Attorney General Eric Schneiderman's 2014 request for information regarding "on call shifts" at retailers such as Abercrombie & Fitch, Gap, Target, and TJX Companies.

This request is being made for non-commercial research purposes and the requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer that the request be filled electronically by e-mail attachment if possible.

Thank you for your assistance with this request. I look forward to receiving your response within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Peter Fugiel
Postdoctoral Research Fellow
Rutgers School of Management & Labor Relations

title: Rockledge, Florida: Language directed at police

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any police report (including any records referenced in the report, such as photographs, body camera recordings, or other records) concerning any alleged violation of Sec. 13-5(22) ("Any person who insults any police officer on the streets, public roads or other places while in the performance of his lawful duties or who makes derogatory or insulting remarks either to or about any police officer, or makes any sign, motion or gesture calculated to insult or humiliate such police officer or officers"). That ordinance may be located at https://library.municode.com/fl/rockledge/codes/code_of_ordinances?nodeId=PTIICOOR_CH13OFMIPR_S13-5DICO.

This request is limited to records generated on or after January 1, 2010.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Tennessee Open Records Act, §10-7-503 et seq., I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records of the complete Hawkins County Sheriff's Office Policies and Procedures from 2021 in its totality, and the full roster of all uniformed officers employed by the Hawkins County Sheriff's Office from 2020-Present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Skylar Park.

communications.subject: RE: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Cumberland County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

Please contact our Legal Counsel Mr. Ronnie Mitchell at rmitchell@ccsonc.org<mailto:rmitchell@ccsonc.org>

Respectfully,


Lieutenant Patrice Bogertey
Public Information Officer
Cumberland County Sheriff’s Office
Fayetteville, North Carolina
(910) 321-6416 Office
pbogertey@ccsonc.org<mailto:pbogertey@ccsonc.org>



Website: https://ccsonc.org/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/Sheriff_EWright
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Sheriff-Ennis-W-Wright-Cumberland-County-NC-297216125951/




________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
This e-mail is for the sole use of the individual for whom it is intended. If you are neither the intended recipient, nor an agent responsible for delivering this e-mail to the intended recipient, any disclosure, retransmission, copying, or reliance on the information contained herein is prohibited.If you have received this e-mail in error, please notify Lieutenant Patrice Bogertey of the Cumberland County Sheriff's Office immediately. All e-mail correspondence to and from my e-mail address may be subject to disclosure to any third party upon request, including media.
It shall not be necessary to disclose: 1) E-mail correspondence which does not constitute a Public Record as defined under N.C.G.S. 132;
or 2) a public record which is exempt from disclosure under other applicable State or Federal law.
Please consider your environment, circumstances and filing capabilities before printing a hard copy of this E-mail.  Once a hard copy has served its purpose, please shred it immediately.

communications.subject: Request for Information
communications.communication:
Good Morning,

This email is to acknowledge receipt of your 91-A request. We will be processing your request in the coming days and weeks.

Please reach out to me if you have any questions.

Thank you,

Sergeant Dan Whelan
Legal and Professional Standards Division
Manchester NH Police Department
405 Valley St, Manchester NH, 03103
dwhelan@manchesternh.gov
603-792-5474


________________________________

The Right-To-Know Law (RSA 91-A) provides that most e-mail communications, to or from City employees and City volunteers regarding the business of the City of Manchester, are government records available to the public upon request. Therefore, this email communication may be subject to public disclosure.



The Right-To-Know Law (RSA 91-A) provides that most e-mail communications, to or from City employees and City volunteers regarding the business of the City of Manchester, are government records available to the public upon request. Therefore, this email communication may be subject to public disclosure

communications.subject: 91-A Request
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

Please see our departments attached response to your below 91-A request for:

"All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits ..."

 Please see our below policy on 91-A fulfillment and advise if you would like copies, and if so how you would like the documents prepared.  Once you advise I will have them waiting for you at our records window.  We are able to accept cash or check as payment for the documents.  If you prefer to view the documents here at our headquarters free of charge just let me know and I will arrange that for you. Also, The records window will be closed this afternoon by 1 PM.

The Manchester Police Department will only be fulfilling 91-A requests in the manner outlined in RSA 91-A:4, IV and RSA 91-A:4, V.  All requests will be fulfilled in person during normal business hours (0730-1500 hrs. Monday - Friday) at the Manchester New Hampshire Police Department Headquarters located at,

405 Valley St
Manchester NH
03103

The department will provide viewing access to these documents, free of charge, by appointment.  If you would like physical copies of the documents they will be provided to you at the below cost,


  1.  $1.00 for the first page
  2.  .50 cents per page after the first page
  3.  $5.00 per CD
  4.  $7.00 per USB

Thank you,

Sergeant Dan Whelan
Legal and Professional Standards Division
Manchester NH Police Department
405 Valley St, Manchester NH, 03103
dwhelan@manchesternh.gov
603-792-5474


________________________________

The Right-To-Know Law (RSA 91-A) provides that most e-mail communications, to or from City employees and City volunteers regarding the business of the City of Manchester, are government records available to the public upon request. Therefore, this email communication may be subject to public disclosure.



The Right-To-Know Law (RSA 91-A) provides that most e-mail communications, to or from City employees and City volunteers regarding the business of the City of Manchester, are government records available to the public upon request. Therefore, this email communication may be subject to public disclosure

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Colorado Springs Police Department)
communications.communication:
The Colorado Springs Police Department (“CSPD”) has received your records request dated on 7/21/2023 and it is under review. The records you have requested are considered criminal justice records as defined in Colorado Revised Statute § 24-72-302(4) which are held in the sole possession of CSPD, a law enforcement agency.  The Colorado Criminal Justice Records Act (“CCJRA”) as codified in C.R.S. § 24-72-301 et. seq. governs the release of criminal justice records.  The time response deadlines contained within CORA do not apply to requests for criminal justice records governed by the CCJRA.


Robert Tornabene
Senior Public Communications Specialist (PIO)
Colorado Springs Police Department
Robert.Tornabene@coloradosprings.gov<mailto:Robert.Tornabene@coloradosprings.gov>

[cid:image001.jpg@01D9BBA1.150C59C0]

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Reading Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure, fleet crashes).

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: P001641-072123
communications.communication:
Dear MuckRock News SYDNEE COGGINS-PRIOLEAU: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of City of Lubbock. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with Chapter 552 of Texas Government Code, the Public Information Act. Your request was received in this office on 7/21/2023 and given the reference number P001641-072123 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: July 21, 2023
To Whom It May Concern:
Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure, fleet crashes).
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant City of Lubbock department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: Chapter 552 of Texas Government Code, the Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Open Records Center. 
City of Lubbock 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Open Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HRGGs3ghQUdE8YXeJnQnD-2Fa7j7mzaGVv3sl-2F5Gous3pMm4upSN-2BxnEtXzmayULdMOgzIvdIoYsTTP3gIW-2FKwh5k-3DdTgk_JCgRfGiLqTYFBQ-2F-2F8r-2F7FRhHNI7JJ2uJVRJgrtWNxkt5M13iPRlXSbFAxMo-2Fppj3O-2B6-2B5gdw-2B-2FBoJViC3PboLzMH1U6tpltLFEXGVhYDODvw5sxdPIMl9WXoWsdYa5UqtpGBsL7rGxmCnP9pe64UWdsmHaVpCeVeoqswCuSrVCcGZ5nLmuPPNyjLIqCu0mwCms-2FoW1E5HxoJV792F-2F41KkxKSs5xc5rknZAWBaWKgEA-3D)

title: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Mt. Juliet Police Department)

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Mt. Juliet Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure, fleet crashes).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau.

communications.subject: RE: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Mt. Juliet Police Department)
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Please go to our website highlighted below for information on Public Records request.  You will need to complete the form and submit it with proof of Tennessee citizen. The contact person is now Lynn Gore.  His email address is lgore@mtjuliet-tn.gov<mailto:lgore@mtjuliet-tn.gov>.

Thank you,

[cid:image001.png@01D9BBAE.20F15210]
Tina Guinan
HR Assistant
City of Mt. Juliet, TN
2425 N. Mt. Juliet Rd.
Mt. Juliet, TN 37122

Phone: 615-754-2552
Direct: 615-773-6254
www.mtjuliet-tn.gov<https://mtjuliet-tn.gov/>

communications.subject: Re: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (DeKalb County Police Department)
communications.communication:
Ms. Prioleau,

DoIT is not the custodian of record for public safety agencies including Police, Sheriff, and Marshalls' office. I have copied the DeKalb County Police Department Open Records unit to prepare a response to your request.


Barry Puckett | Deputy Director of Infrastructure | DeKalb County Government | Bobby Burgess Building | 3630 Camp Circle | Decatur, GA 30032 | Cell: 404.398.4797 | Email: jbpuckett@dekalbcountyga.gov<mailto:jbpuckett@dekalbcountyga.gov> | http://www.dekalbcountyga.gov<http://www.dekalbcountyga.gov/>

The Goodyear Police Department maintains a policy of transparency with the community and makes this and other policies available on our website. The policy you have requested can be accessed using the following address:
https://public.powerdms.com/GOODPD/tree/documents/392218 

To access all publicly available policies, please use the following address:
https://public.powerdms.com/GOODPD/tree

Sergeant S. Tyler #1230 

Goodyear Police Department  
City of Goodyear, Arizona  
11 N. 145th Ave  
Goodyear, AZ 85338  
v 623-882-7722 
e styler@goodyearaz.gov

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Oklahoma Highway Patrol)
communications.communication:
Hello,
To whom it may concern:

Please see the attached required form and submit it back to this email. This form is also a fillable form from the DPS Website https://Oklahoma.gov/dps.html

Respectfully,

Sharmon Pollard
Sharmon Pollard
Administrative Assistant
Open Records Division
405 425-2103

[cid:image001.png@01D9BBAE.18F0FB10]
DISCLAIMER: Information provided by the Oklahoma Department of Public Safety, to include information contained in the Department of Public Safety website or provided in response to any inquiry, is intended as general information only. Any related link or reference to other information is not intended to be a warranty or endorsement of the completeness, accuracy or quality of that information. Legal information provided by the Department Public Safety is not intended to be legal advice and is not a substitute for the advice of professional legal counsel. You should always consult an attorney to determine how the law applies to you. CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE: This e-mail and any attachments are confidential and may be protected by legal privilege.  If you are not the intended recipient of the message, do not read it, forward it, print it or save it.  Please delete the message and notify the sender.

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Manchester Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure, fleet crashes).

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: Manchester pursuit policy request
communications.communication:
Good morning,

I received your request for our pursuit policy. The cost will be $6.50. Please send a check payable to Manchester Police Department along with a self-addressed, stamped (with enough postage for 13 pages) envelope to P.O. Box 191, Manchester, CT 06045-0191.

Heather Parrott
Admin. Records Supervisor
Manchester Police Department
Manchester, CT
860-645-5529

communications.subject: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Maine State Police)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure, fleet crashes).

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau
